comment: She grades very harsh and even if you follow her directions exactly you may not get the grade you should.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Tough grader

comment: This class was online, but it was VERY group project led. I would say more than half of the course was spent in our groups working on assignments/presentations. One grade is given for the whole group, so if your members do not do the work then youll have to do it for a good grade. One final project at the end (group presentation) so no final exam.
Very clear about what she expects. She is extremely knowledgeable and clearly enjoys what she does. Had a group project,  a few quizzes and a paper but no test. Would take her again !

All of her test are online, one group project, discussion post and paper that you can partner with someone for. Her lectures were very interesting as well. Stay on top of your assignments and come to class. You will do well. I would take her again!

I did everything as requested per the syllabus, and her verbal instructions during class. I still winded up getting lower grades than I was expecting. When I had difficulty in the class I asked for help and she was helpful with helping me to understand. She is a great teacher, but she grades harsh. Plan on getting your feelings hurt grade wise.
Dr. Collard is a wonderful professor.  She is helpful, fair and thorough.  There is one presentation and a volunteer assignment.  Tests are taken at home online.

Dr. Collard is a great professor.  She has really good powerpoints.  She will use class notes, powerpoints, book content, and any special presentations when writing the tests. Go to class if you can cause it's an easy 5 points on your grade if you miss two classes or less.

Dr. Collard is AMAZING! She is extremely knowledgeable and presents the material well. READ YOUR BOOK because she will call you out in a heartbeat and attendance is mandatory. Grades come from mid/final and volunteer hours, and the projects that go along with it, which she is very lax on. She loves disagreements - but be ready to back yourself up!
Dr. Collard is a very nice person however, her class is very boring and hard to pay attention to. Way too much material on one exam without any preparation.
She's a very kind professor. Gives lots of bonus. She has a lot of patience.
